info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:32AM EST until January 10 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Berne affecting Berks County. For the Schuylkill River...including Berne...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Berne. * WHEN...From early this morning to this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Open adjacent land begins to flood between Shoemakersville and Hamburg. At 12.0 feet, Miller Street in Shoemakersville floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 AM EST Wednesday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to a crest of 12.2 feet this morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Berne 12.0 12.1 Wed 2 am 9.3 8.5 12.2 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM EST.
